intro: Streptocaulon chinense, commonly known as Chinese streptocaulon, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
